Private Litigation Case Title: Colon v. QBE North America et al.

Description: QBE Insurance agreed to pay more than $2.4 million in refunds to homeowners who were improperly charged for force-placed property insurance. This settlement was a result of the audit agreed to in a previous settlement.
QBE Insurance agreed to pay $375,000 plus restitution in settlement of allegations it improperly charged for force-placed insurance policies.

Agency: Arizona Department of Insurance and Financial Institutions
Notes: This case was brought by the Arizona Department of Insurance before it merged with the Department of Financial Institutions.

Agency: Arizona Department of Insurance and Financial Institutions
Notes: This case was brought by the Arizona Department of Insurance before it merged with the Department of Financial Institutions.

Company: Praetorian Insurance Co. and QBE Insurance Corp. and QBE Speciality Insurance Co.

Notes: Order notes settlement of consumer complaint, included in penalty.

Company: Praetorian Insurance Co. and Redland Insurance Co.
Praetorian Insurance Co. and Stonington Insurance Co.
QBE Insurance Co. and Praetorian Insurance Co.

Description: QBE Holdings, Inc., QBE Insurance Corp., and QBE Speciality Insurance Co. agreed to pay $750,000 as part of a settlement of allegations their Force-Placed insurance activity violated regulations by paying improper rebates to loan servicers and charged excessive premiums in a non-competitive market, as well as allegations they provided incorrect information to the Department of Commerce.

Agency: New Jersey Department of Banking & Insurance

Description: QBE agreed to pay $10 million and adopt reforms in its force-placed insurance practices in a settlement with the Department of Financial Services.
Agency: New York Department of Financial Services

Description: The Department of Financial Services fined QBE Insurance Corp. $750,000 for unlawfully issuing accident-only policies to institutions of higher education in New York to cover their enrolled students.
Agency: New York Department of Financial Services

Description: Company fined for using incorrect fire protection classes and incorrect territorial mulitpliers (state zones) when rating Commercial Farmowners Package Policies. Order issued with Compliance Plan. RCW 48.19.040(6).
Agency: Washington State Office of the Insurance Commissioner
Wisconsin Office of the Commissioner of Insurance
Wisconsin Office of the Commissioner of Insurance
Wisconsin Office of the Commissioner of Insurance

Description: QBE agreed to pay more than $21 million to a group of states as part of the resolution of an examination of its forced-placed insurance operations.

Agency: New York Department of Financial Services
